ARABIC: رَبِّ ٱجْعَلْنِى مُقِيمَ ٱلصَّلَوٰةِ وَمِن ذُرِّيَّتِى رَبَّنَا وَتَقَبَّلْ دُعَآءِ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: My Lord! Make me and my descendants people who establish salat. My Lord! Accept my prayer.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Grant, O Lord, that I and my offspring may remain constant in devotion. Grant, O Lord, my supplication.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: My Lord! Enable me and my offspring to establish Prayer, and do accept, our Lord, this prayer of mine.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: Lord, make me and my offspring steadfast in prayer and accept our worship.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: “O my Lord! Maintain me as one who establishes prayer, and some of my descendants; O our Lord! and accept my prayer.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: O my Lord! Make me one who performs Salah, and (also) from my offspring, our Lord! And accept my invocation."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: My Lord! make me keep up prayer and from my offspring (too), O our Lord, and accept my prayer:
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: My Lord, make me a performer of the prayer, and of my seed. Our Lord, and receive my petition.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: My Lord! Make me to establish proper worship, and some of my posterity (also); our Lord! and accept my prayer.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: Lord, grant that I may keep up the prayer, and so may my offspring. My Lord, accept my prayer.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: My Lord! make me establisher of prayer and also from my progeny, our Lord! and accept Thou my supplication.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: My Lord! Make me a maintainer of prayer, and my descendants [as well]. Our Lord, accept my supplication.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: O my Lord! make me one who establishes regular Prayer, and also (raise such) among my offspring O our Lord! and accept Thou my Prayer.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: O my Lord! Make me one who performs As-Salat (Iqamat-as-Salat), and (also) from my offspring, our Lord! And accept my invocation.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: My Lord, make me and my descendants establishers of prayer. Our Lord, accept my prayer.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: “My Lord, make me one who performs the prayer, and from my offspring. Our Lord, accept my supplication.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: My Lord, make me an establisher of prayer, and [many] from my descendants. Our Lord, and accept my supplication.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [14:40] My Lord, make me an establisher of prayer, and, make, of my seed, those who will establish it (the use of [partitive] min [in min dhurriyatī, ‘of my seed’] is because God informed him that some of them [his seed] would be disbelievers). Our Lord! And accept my supplication, the [supplication] mentioned.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (My Lord!) my lord! (Make me to establish proper worship) make me perform the prayer properly, (and some of my posterity (also)) he says: bless me and bless my offspring so that we perform the prayer properly; (our Lord!) our Lord! (and accept the prayer) accept my worship.
